subject: packaging: Bump to 0.5.9
commitMessage:
packaging: Bump to 0.5.9

Skip downstream changes

skip 9a6e4b0 Fix issue of mem map
skip pick 341b3a6 add foreign wl_display/wl_surface support
skip 5ecba2a add 'frame-rendered' signal for wayland platform
skip 8b41ff8 wayland: retain additional 3 gst buffer after video rendering
skip 9b936db destroy wl_buffer by register to wl_buffer_listener
skip 8a5ea40 wayland: disable crop support by vpp
skip 36d7453 wayland: update frame sync callback
skip 1c09675 h264 dec: add more checks from pps for hardware profile
skip 0549a7d add gst_vaapi_plugin_base_set_native_display

skip b55a697 spec: update for gst 1.2 build

Change-Id: Ib33e43ac85c32a22a640bbd70209ef9aa0c5895f
Signed-off-by: Philippe Coval <philippe.coval@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: wayland: disable crop support by vpp
commitMessage:
wayland: disable crop support by vpp

1080P video got a mismatch 1088 video surface size,
this mistach will lead to vpp and some failure.

temp disable vpp to avoid the exception for IVI release, I will look
at the root reason next.

Change-Id: Ia42e15ea898da060dc679aa5e1b69c6459fbdb72

subject: wayland: retain additional 3 gst buffer after video rendering
commitMessage:
wayland: retain additional 3 gst buffer after video rendering

after wl_buffer is commited to wayland server, it is kept using until next
buffer is commited. so we'd retain 3 buffers after video rendering in media side.
 - one buffer for the one is used as texture in wayland compositing (front buffer)
 - one buffer for the one just committed (back buffer)
 - one buffer additional when wayland compositing is slower than media side

Change-Id: I8f8e3b1a3ec6c870918766fec8f6d2341ddbd8e5

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: destroy wl_buffer by register to wl_buffer_listener
commitMessage:
destroy wl_buffer by register to wl_buffer_listener

1. frame callback is used to unblock media pipeline to update a new buffer,
   frame callback proxy uses the event queue.
2. WL_BUFFER_RELEASE/wl_buffer_send_release() is used to destroy wl_buffer
   for now, wl_buffer proxy doesn't use event queue, otherwise event_queue can't be
   destroyed in gst_vaapi_window_wayland_destroy()

Change-Id: Ic6f633c459c1ad878091bb176d321e9af2105723

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: vaapidecode: pull from master to fix pause&seek.
commitMessage:
vaapidecode: pull from master to fix pause&seek.

1. decode last frame in output adapter.
2. protect videopool using a mutex
3. do not use timeout in decode thread.

Change-Id: Ie71d64ecae89fd9dd6ad0f3921ecbafc5d569fd6
Signed-off-by: Guangxin.Xu <Guangxin.Xu@intel.com>

subject: fixes when vappsink renders to simple wayland compositor
commitMessage:
fixes when vappsink renders to simple wayland compositor

in order to share buffer between Web and UI process of WebKit on wayland,
webkit implemented a simple wayland server which support
wl_display/wl_compositor interface only.
it is something like rendering to offscreen for Wayland.

subject: utils: fix build with <GL/glext.h> version >= 85.
commitMessage:
utils: fix build with <GL/glext.h> version >= 85.

Mesa recently updated the <GL/glext.h> header version to Khronos version 85.
This caused the PFNGLMULTITEXCOORD2FPROC definition to be moved out of the
GL_VERSION_1_3_DEPRECATED block. However, since <GL/gl.h> also defines
GL_VERSION_1_3 to 1, the definitions in <GL/glext.h> are then not enabled,
thus leaving PFNGLMULTITEXCOORD2FPROC undefined as well.

Provide a PFNGLMULTITEXCOORD2FPROC replacement as an interim solution for
newer versions of the <GL/glext.h> header.
